channel.title: OpenFoundry - Recently Added Listings - File synchronization

item.title: CloudSafe
item.description:
CloudSafe GmbH focuses on the development of software and the operation of services in the area of cryptography.

Reference: https://secure.cloudsafe.com/
item.author: dio

item.title: Sugarsync
item.description:
SugarSync is a provider of Personal Cloud services that enable users to access ALL of their data, anytime, anywhere, and from any device.

Reference: https://www.sugarsync.com/
item.author: dio

item.title: Dropbox
item.description:
Dropbox is a Web-based file hosting service operated by Dropbox, Inc. that uses cloud computing to enable users to store and share files and folders with others across the Internet using file synchronization.

Platform: Linux / Windows / Mac

References: https://www.dropbox.com/ https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dropbox
item.author: dio

item.title: Ceph
item.description:
Ceph is a free software distributed file system initially created by Sage Weil. Ceph's main goals are to be POSIX-compatible, and completely distributed without a single point of failure.

Platform: Linux;License: LGPL

References: https://ceph.newdream.net/about/ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ceph
item.author: dio

item.title: Live Mesh
item.description:
Live Mesh is a data synchronization system from Microsoft that allows files, folders and other data to be shared and synchronized across multiple personal devices and up to 5GB on the web.

Platform: Windows / Mac

References: https://www.mesh.com/welcome/default.aspx https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Live_Mesh
item.author: dio
